data.title: Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of Los Angeles
data.meta_site_name: Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of Los Angeles
data.text:
We recognize that the diversity of the community we serve must be reflected in every aspect of our organization for JBBBSLA and Camp Bob Waldorf to have the greatest impact. Our commitment to justice, equity, diversity and inclusion is vital to our mission and is essential for our success.

HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGER

Status: Full-time, Exempt

Salary: $67,000-$70,000 per year Agency Location: Los Angeles

Working Location: Successful applicant will work 3-4 days per week in-person in our Los Angeles office and 1-2 days per week remotely, year-round. This is not a fully remote position.

Job Summary

The Human Resources Manager will manage employee recruitment, compensation and benefits, personnel policies, regulatory compliance, and facilitate a positive work environment for all staff. The ideal candidate is a dynamic professional skilled in building and managing relationships with a wide range of individuals. The new team member should be helpful, empathetic, creative, collaborative, and organized with proven understanding of California employment law and HR practices.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Manage employee recruitment through job postings, resume review, interviews, and hiring.

Coordinate offer letters, compensation packages, benefit review and all aspects of onboarding for new employees.

Oversee all employee benefits enrollment including open enrollment, new employee enrollment, etc.

Manage any EDD, worker’s compensation and other claims as needed.

Manage employee relations and retention by engaging in conversations with staff, identifying issues, developing performance improvement plans, job analysis, and other resources to support employees.

Coordinate consistent performance reviews of all staff in partnership with management team.

Maintain knowledge of California employment law and HR policies.

Coordinate annual updates of the employee handbook.

Develop HR policies and procedures that align with agency goals and state regulations.

Assign and coordinate staff trainings required.

Create activities and celebrations that support a positive work environment.

Support CEO in additional responsibilities as needed.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Skills and Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years of HR experience.

Experience with ADP Workforce Now employee record and payroll system.

Experience working with union and non-union employees.

Advanced skills in Microsoft Word and Excel required.

Personal commitment to the mission and values of the organization.

Must be organized, strategic and forward thinking with a strong attention to detail.

Ability to handle multiple projects, set priorities, and meet deadlines.

Ability to work weekends and evenings as needed.

Upbeat personality and sense of humor strongly appreciated!

Additional Benefits

Hybrid-remote schedule

Short Fridays (office closes early at 3:30 PM)

Generous paid vacation, sick leave, and personal days

Paid federal and Jewish holidays (13-19 per year)

5% matching 403b retirement plan (after one year)

Medical, vision, and dental insurance

Paid life and long-term disability insurance

Voluntary 403b retirement plan (immediate)

Voluntary Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA)

Pet insurance discounts

Perhaps most importantly, you’ll get to work with a fantastic team of people who truly care about the work that we do.

To Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to jbbbslahr@gmail.com with “Human Resources Manager” in the subject line.

**No phone calls or employment/staffing agencies, please. **

CAMP LEASING MANAGER

Successful applicants are required to work in person, year-round at Camp Bob Waldorf in Glendale, CA. Not a remote position. Overnight attendance and supervision on site is a requirement when rental groups are present. During Summer Camp Programming (June – August), this position supports the Camp Program Team while preparing for the upcoming rental season. Onsite living available. COVID-19 Vaccination Required.

Status: Year-round, full-time, Exempt

Salary: $67,000-$70,000 per year Agency Location: Camp Bob Waldorf (Glendale, CA)

Working Location: Position is based out of the Camp Bob Waldorf office in Glendale, CA year-round. Position is required to live onsite during overnight programs (housing and meals provided).

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Camp Leasing Manager at Camp Bob Waldorf is integral in fulfilling the camp mission. At the core of our mission is making sure that all campers and groups are provided with the care that they need to have a fun, positive, and enriching experience while they are at camp.

The Camp Leasing Manager position stewards the leasing program year-round. General management of the weekend and mid-week program, which includes, but is not limited to the following; Focusing on marketing/promotions, guiding tours and sales, negotiating and writing contracts, running and overseeing high quality programming through camp offered activities, neighborhood relations, managing a team of supplemental camp hosts, and overseeing food service operations for groups.

Through utilizing the best practices of the camping and wellness industry the Camp Leasing Manager will help the groups, staff and their campers reach their fullest potential during their stay at camp.

Our residential Jewish and non-sectarian camp programs, weekend retreats, outdoor backpacking trips, college scholarship programs and mentoring activities provide over 1,200 youth each year with a safe, nurturing environment where they learn to be creative, responsible, and thoughtful individuals.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Creatively market and promote Camp Bob Waldorf leasing program on our website, through social media, in person and via phone calls or referrals to maximize consistent occupancy during non-summer (September-May) weekends and weekdays.

Collaborate with the Camp Director, JBBBSLA Leadership and Camp Committee to diversify leasing outreach, improve programming and maximize revenue.

Facilitate tours year-round for prospective group leaders, provide input, suggestions and guidance on requests and program facilitation in accordance with group needs and camp facility limitations.

Maintain and nurture relationships with group leaders and administrators through clear and frequent communication.

Format and input specific group requirements including costs, deposits, programmatic needs, food service needs and insurance details into the existing CBW groups contract system.

Monitor deposits, receipt of signed contracts, group minimum numbers, food service requests and facility set up needs prior to groups stay at camp.

Manage and update annual leasing calendar including prioritizing Camp Retreats and Summer Programming annually. Regularly communicate with food service, camp program and facilities teams regarding changes to calendar and specifics related to groups.

Welcome all groups to camp and facilitate an orientation to the camps rules and guidelines including, but not limited to, specifics on the camp environment, supervision, neighbor relations, noise regulations, food service, nighttime and emergency contacts, housekeeping services and any reporting facility issues.

Live onsite and be present and available throughout the groups stay at camp. Be available for phone calls from group leaders 24 hours a day and able and willing to respond to all needs and emergencies as they arise.

Maintain communication with the Camp’s Head Chef to provide food service requirements of the highest level. Monitor feedback related to food quality and quantity and communicate clearly with Head Chef on a weekly basis.

Communicate regularly with Lead Facilities Technician to provide group’s set up needs such as conference rooms, sound systems, chair distribution, water and table placements and facility issues/repairs as they arise.

Manage hosting staff team. Provide training, supervision and timekeeping management for weekend and weekday program staff. Manage and assign hosting staff during required kitchen shifts. Regularly monitor performance and provide feedback to all hosting staff.

Create and maintain safety systems for all aspects of leasing group programming including Ropes Course/Climbing Wall, Archery, Swimming Pool and others.

Provide groups with consistently high quality, safe programmatic requirements per leasing contract.

Provide all group leaders with an opportunity to debrief and evaluate their stay and analyze comments and data monthly.

Work with the Camp Director:

Communicate weekly regarding group schedules, needs, budget development and facility requirements.

Take the lead on high ropes and climbing wall training, maintenance and facilitation year-round.

Work with the entire Camp and JBBBSLA Team:

Create and maintain a community where everyone feels physically, socially, emotionally, and spiritually welcome and safe.

Work closely with other divisions of JBBBSLA (Mentoring, Development, College Access & Success) to communicate leasing groups who are connected with other JBBBSLA programs.

Summer Camp season duties:

Work in a limited capacity as outlined by Camp Director to provide support where necessary for Camp Programming Team during busy summer camp season.

Facilitate tours, outreach, calendar management and contract development during summer season.

Other duties as assigned.

ON A TEAM

The Camp Leasing Manager will work closely with all members of the camp department and will be supervised by the Camp Director. The Camp Leasing Manager will take the lead in the camp rental business year-round. The position will also interact with other members of JBBBSLA including staff members of the Development, Finance, College Access & Success, Mentoring Program and HR/Operations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.

3-5 years of experience in working with rental or leasing groups/events in a camp setting preferred.

1-3 years of sales, hospitality, and/or marketing experience preferred.

Experience in creating, planning and implementing impactful events and or group programming.

2-3 years of administrative or enrollment-based experience.

Strong oral and written communication skills.

Positive energy, helpful attitude, well-developed interpersonal skills, open mind, and empathy.

Strong initiative and a willingness to go the extra mile for those that we serve.

ADDITIONAL BENEFITS:

Generous paid vacation and sick leave plus four additional personal days

Paid federal and Jewish holidays (avg. 13-19 paid holidays per year)

5% matching 403b retirement plan (after one year)

Medical, vision and dental insurance

Paid life insurance

Paid long-term disability insurance

Voluntary 403b retirement plan (immediate)

Voluntary Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA)

Pet Insurance discounts

To Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to jbbbslahr@gmail.com with “Camp Leasing Manager” in the subject line.

**No phone calls or employment/staffing agencies, please. **

OFFICE ASSISTANT

Status: Full-time (38-hour work week), Non-Exempt

Pay: $25-$28.00 per hour

Agency Location: Based in Los Angeles

Working Location: Based in Los Angeles office 3 days/week in-person and 2 days remotely, year-round. This is not a fully remote position.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The primary role of the Office Assistant will provide ongoing administrative support to the CEO approximately 20 hours per week. Additionally, the role will also support the Director of College Access & Success approximately 18 hours per week. This job requires exceptional organizational skills to manage multiple responsibilities, strong verbal communication skills, and acute attention to detail.

ESSENTIAL ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create All-Hands Meeting agenda monthly and collect program updates from staff.

Create, manage and distribute bi-weekly Managers Meeting agenda.

Support for semi-monthly Board Meetings; create agenda, collect other materials, attend and take minutes, save all documents in PDF form for distribution to board members.

Order dinner for board meetings.

Order celebration treats for monthly All Hands meetings

Order lunch when needed for meetings and staff.

Confirm CEO meetings daily and help schedule follow up meetings.

Create email communications for board communication, committee and other group emails as assigned.

Schedule committee and board meetings as assigned.

Work with program staff to bring tasks to the attention of the CEO.

Assist in managing CEO daily schedule, to do list, phone call list, and calendar.

Complete monthly credit card reconciliation for accounting.

Answer phones for agency main line daily.

Order office supplies, snacks, and other materials as needed.

Update the staff contact list as new staff are hired or leave and send to DOO.

Organize and send out monthly e-birthday, anniversary and other cards to staff.

Ensure kitchen and break areas are maintained and supplied daily.

Print, stuff, and mail acknowledgement letters to donors.

Send special gifts to Bigs and other constituents as needed – baby onesie, graduation gift, sponsorship gifts, etc.

Performs other duties as assigned.

COLLEGE ACCESS & SUCCESS SUMMARY:

Assist Director of College Access & Success approximately 18 hours per week with administrative responsibilities to support program needs.

ESSENTIAL PROGRAM RESPONSIBILITIES:

Coordinate check requests and award disbursements for scholarships.

Assist in the production of events as needed.

Assist with outreach and communication for the program via email, text and phone calls.

Organize data relevant to College Access & Success.

Maintain all tracking documents relevant to the program.

Create and maintain accurate constituent records for the program.

Assist with creating and distributing surveys pre and post program.

Assist with other projects as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent 2-3 years of experience as an administrative assistant or other support role.

Advanced skills in Microsoft Word and Excel required.

Strong attention to detail and follow-through.

Well-developed organizational and time management skills.

Positive attitude for customer service and interaction with donors, board members and volunteers.

Able to work independently and as part of a team.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to manage multiple responsibilities successfully.

Personal commitment to the mission and values of the organization. Passionate about helping children in Los Angeles.

Willingness to perform other duties as assigned.

ADDITIONAL BENEFITS:

Hybrid-remote schedule

Short Fridays: we close early on Fridays every week (3:30PM)

Generous paid vacation and sick leave plus four additional personal days

Paid federal and Jewish holidays (avg. 13-19 paid holidays per year)

5% matching 403b retirement plan (after one year)

Medical, vision and dental insurance

Paid life insurance

Paid long-term disability insurance

Voluntary 403b retirement plan (immediate)

Voluntary Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA)

Pet Insurance discounts

Perhaps most importantly, you’ll get to work with a fantastic team of people who truly care about the work that we do.

To Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to jbbbslahr@gmail.com with “Office Assistant” in the subject line.

**No phone calls or employment/staffing agencies, please. **

ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR, MENTORING SERVICES

Department: Youth Mentoring

Status: Full-time (38-hour work week), Exempt Professional

Salary: $68,000-$72,000 per year (DOE)Agency Location: Based in Los Angeles

Working Location: Based in Los Angeles (Hybrid schedule). Position will work 3 days in-person in our Los Angeles office and 2 days remotely, year-round. This is not a fully remote position.

Job Summary

The Associate Director works closely with the VP of Mentoring Services to lead the department, overseeing enrollment, matching, and match support functions. This role involves supervising staff, ensuring child safety and fostering positive relationships and impact for youth, as well as ensuring high-level customer service and promoting meaningful engagement with JBBBSLA for all constituents. Additionally, the Associate Director will provide some direct service, and serve as a Mentor Trainer and Matchforce Administrator, supporting data and reporting functions.

Key Responsibilities Include, but are not limited to, the following:

Team Leadership:

Supervise enrollment, matching, and match support functions, ensuring compliance with BBBS standards

Oversee staff hiring, onboarding, workload distribution, and Matchforce training.

Conduct team trainings, QA reviews and individual coaching in support of staff growth and development

Make difficult decisions regarding constituents and matches, utilizing outstanding professional judgment and insight

Monitor child safety scores.

Support VP with data functions and provide relevant reports and dashboards for team

Enrollment & Matching:

Develop and oversee standardized, documented protocols for all enrollment functions

Schedule info sessions and pre-match trainings at regular intervals, while adapting to changing needs.

Monitor enrollment pipeline and hold staff accountable for thoroughness, efficiency and quality assessments and services.

Conduct enrollments and match introduction meetings as needed

Oversee match selection processes in support of strong and appropriate match relationships.

Match Support:

Maintain familiarity with match population to ensure child safety, as well as healthy, rewarding experiences for Bigs and Littles.

Conduct scheduled match support contacts, modeling outstanding documentation for staff.

Provide support and interventions for challenging matches.

Administer and utilize surveys to evaluate programmatic effectiveness and impact on youth.

Help develop and execute ongoing training opportunities for volunteers

Skills and Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in human services, social services, child development, psychology, education, or a related field.

Outstanding leadership, coaching and supervision skills.

Exceptional professional judgment and interpersonal insight applied to complex processes and difficult decisions

Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to accurately capture nuance

Proficiency in Microsoft Office and in Matchforce database, reports and dashboards.

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

Reliable transportation and willingness to travel as needed.

Ability to work flexible hours, including some evenings and weekends.

Compensation and Benefits

Hybrid-remote schedule

Short Fridays (office closes early at 3:30 PM)

Generous paid vacation, sick leave, and personal days

Paid federal and Jewish holidays (13-19 per year)

5% matching 403b retirement plan (after one year)

Medical, vision, and dental insurance

Paid life and long-term disability insurance

Voluntary 403b retirement plan (immediate)

Voluntary Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA)

Pet insurance discounts

Join this fantastic team and contribute to meaningful work!

To Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to jbbbslahr@gmail.com with “Associate Director” in the subject line.

**No phone calls or employment/staffing agencies, please. **

——————————————————————————————————-

COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT MANAGER

Department: Youth Mentoring

Status: Full-time (38-hour work week), Exempt Professional, Non-Union Employee

Agency Location: Based in Los Angeles

Working Location: Based in Los Angeles – combination of remote and office-based

Summary

Reporting to the VP of Mentoring Services, the Community Engagement Manager leads and drives recruitment initiatives for the Youth Mentoring (YM) Program. Their efforts should yield Jewish Bigs and Littles in sufficient numbers to meet our match goals. As a dynamic brand ambassador, the Community Engagement Manager identifies individuals, groups and institutions likely to benefit from information about the YM program for both participants and volunteers. They work to cultivate widespread visibility for the agency, cultivating long-term, sustainable community partnerships through effective collaboration efforts, particularly within the Jewish community. They tell the agency story in compelling ways, using multiple avenues of communication in order to strategically draw new constituents to JBBBSLA. The Community Engagement Manager retains a deep understanding of the agency’s overall needs, develops and maintains strategic plans, and collaborates effectively with both internal and external partners for ongoing success.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Strategic Planning and Outreach

Develop innovative strategies for recruitment of Bigs and Littles that yield the numbers needed to reach YM match goals.

Effectively track potential and existing connections in the Los Angeles Jewish Community and conduct regular follow-up.

Identify diverse leads in the community, plan regular outreach activities, and develop strategic partnerships with community leaders and organizations.

Coordinate with Program Manager and develop an effective outreach plan to ensure appropriate follow-up with incomplete enrollments and with Bigs who complete matches and don’t immediately reenroll.

Maintain familiarity with community resources for children/families and develop strong working relationships with youth and family service providers.

Establish a presence at community and volunteer events for recruitment and visibility opportunities.

Make meaningful contact using a variety of techniques, including in-person meetings and presentations, recruitment fairs, tabling opportunities, web-based applications, phone, email and videochat.

Internal Collaboration

Work closely with the YM team to fully understand recruitment needs, remain cognizant of changes over time, and target efforts accordingly.

Coordinate with Program Manager/Enrollment Team to refer qualified children/teens, families and volunteers in a streamlined manner, and conduct appropriate follow-up.

Leverage the support of existing volunteers, donors and board members to create new leads.

Partner with JBBBSLA’s marketing and communications staff and/or contractors, ensuring mutual understanding of needs and resources.

Develop strong internal relationships and communication in order to effectively coordinate external engagement activities.

Leverage recruitment opportunities related to Big Impact Group LA (BIG LA).

Maintain a deep understanding of agency’s overall needs and engagement opportunities in order to leverage stakeholders’ interests in other areas of the agency (e.g., as donors, committee or board members, volunteers for our camp or College Access & Success, etc.).

Collect and analyze data around targeted metrics to share progress with YM Program, the Development Department and others as requested.

Youth Mentoring Committee (YMC) Leadership

Serve as the agency lead for the recruitment arm of the Youth Mentoring Committee (YMC), assisting with the committee’s development and oversight.

Work with YMC Chair to develop and execute effective strategies using this group of diverse stakeholders, leveraging their resources and providing support for members’ participation.

Develop a system to ensure committee members have easy access to information about our outreach network, including recent developments and current status, in order to facilitate streamlined communication and coordinated outreach.

Ensure that members’ efforts and referrals are recognized and receive prompt follow-up.

Provide monthly data/reports to the YMC with targeted metrics so progress is transparent and inspiring.

External Relations and Community Partners

Discern and promote suitable opportunities for external organizations to become involved with JBBBSLA in mutually beneficial ways.

Establish collaborative alliances and sustainable partnerships for agency visibility, leading to increased enrollment of children and adults in YM, especially with faith-based organizations.

Assist in developing MOUs for new partnerships, as needed.

Nurture our existing community relationships so that they gain traction and deepen over time.

As needed, provide training for community partners around identifying and speaking to prospective children and families who could benefit from agency programs.

Serve as agency liaison for Big Brother Big Sister of America’s Recruitment Across the Federation (RAF)

Serve as agency liaison for Jewish Family Service of Los Angeles’ Special Needs Collaborative.

Miscellaneous

As needed, facilitate Information Sessions for prospective volunteers and parents/guardians.

Perform other duties as required in support of program or agency operations.

Skills required

Research: Able to identify individuals, groups and institutions likely to benefit from information about agency programs and or volunteer opportunities.

Outreach: can make meaningful contact with constituents using the full breadth of communication modalities.

Relationship-building: Proven success in building and maintaining relationships.

Sales: skilled at “selling” agency programs and volunteer opportunities with authenticity; appeals to and engages constituents.

Organizing: effectively mobilizes individuals toward a common purpose.

Public speaking: engages diverse audiences in discussion about the needs of JBBBSLA and the community, and how they might dovetail with personal growth and satisfaction.

Diplomacy: Capable of discussing clients’ needs in an honest and respectful manner and recognizes the need for balancing individual and agency interests.

Time management: leverages responsibility to colleagues with that of community partners; organizes and manages time effectively.

Strategic thinking: considers and analyzes long-term goals so as to develop a plan with informed intentionality.

Leadership: comfortable and competent motivating individuals and groups.

Minimum Qualifications

We are seeking a candidate with a strong belief in the Mission and Vision of JBBBSLA, as well as the following:

Minimum Bachelors’ degree

Three (3) to five (5) years of successful sales, customer service, and outreach/campaign experience.

Demonstrated success in strategic planning, project management and cultivating resources.

Familiarity with non-profit organizations and working knowledge of the LA Jewish community.

Proven success in developing rapport with individuals and groups from diverse sectors and building and maintaining relationships.\

Ability to work successfully in a collaborative environment.

Significant exposure to child, teen and volunteer populations with a general knowledge of child development.

Experience developing and executing events/activities.

Strong organizational skills, detail-orientation, and ability to work within a budget.

Ability to communicate (verbally and in writing) about opportunities in an engaging manner that appeals to various populations and engages community partners.

Strong computer skills (medium to intermediate level) to include MS Office Programs, comfort learning a new database and researching opportunities on-line.

Must have car, valid driver’s license, and meet state required automobile insurance minimums.

Successful applicant will work three days in-person in our Los Angeles office and two days remotely, year-round. This is not a fully remote position.

Must be able to work some evening/weekend hours and have some flexibility with schedule (related to outreach calendar). Position will involve occasional travel to develop community relationships and participate in off-site, recruitment-related activities.

Compensation and Benefits

We offer a compensation package that includes a competitive salary range, and other benefits, including:

Hybrid-remote schedule

Short Fridays: we close early on Fridays every week (3:30 PM)

Generous paid vacation and sick leave plus three additional personal days

Paid federal and Jewish holidays (avg. 13-19 paid holidays per year)

5% matching 403b retirement plan (after one year)

Medical, vision and dental insurance

Paid life insurance

Paid long-term disability insurance

Voluntary 403b retirement plan (immediate)

Voluntary Flexible Spending Account (FSA) / Health Savings Account (HSA)

Pet Insurance discounts

Perhaps most importantly, you’ll get to work with a fantastic team of people who truly care about the work that we do, in a position that has much potential for growth.

Job Type: Full-time Exempt

Salary: $66,560 – $70,000 per year

To Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to jbbbslahr@gmail.com with “Community Engagement Manager” in the subject line.
